definitions: an interlacing, twining, looping, etc., of a cord or rope, drawn tight into a compact manner, used to fasten, bind, or tie together.
a group or cluster of persons or things.
a unit of speed equal to one nautical mile per hour, used especially for ships and aircraft.
a painful or uncomfortable feeling in a group of muscles along with tightness.
examples: She tied a knot in the rope.
I have a knot in my shoulder.
